page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT IN MIDDLETON
page.content: The cotton trade and silk-weaving were once major areas of employment in Middleton. Now there are other, varied areas of employment. Middleton has a population of about 51,500. Numbers employed in primary industry and construction have declined in the last 30 years, employing 0.15% & 3% of the working population respectively. Middleton suffered badly in the recession of the '20s & '30s and in the last 30 years unemployment has risen again from 661 t0 4,155. The biggest changes are seen in textiles decreasing from the employ- ment of over half the working population in 1951, to a present-day 3%. Areas of growth are the clothing industry, from 2% in 1971 to 6.5% in 1981, and the distribution industry from 4.4% in 1951 to 11% in 1977.
